forkee.name: testify
forkee.description: A toolkit with common assertions and mocks that plays nicely with the standard library

pull_request.title: upgrade objx to fix vulnerability
pull_request.body:
## Summary
This PR is to upgrade the objx dependency from 0.4.0 to 0.5.0

## Changes
Changed `go.mod` and `go.sum` files

## Motivation
Since the objx package 0.5.0 was released with a vulnerability fix made by dependabot, we could use the newest version of it.
This also will fix a vulnerability found in objx 0.4.0, by using the yamlv3 3.0.0 indirectly throught testify 1.7.1.

**current dependency tree**
```
- objx v0.4.0
   - testify v1.7.1
      - yaml.v3 v3.0.0
```

**Vulnerability details:**
https://security.snyk.io/package/golang/github.com%2Fgo-yaml%2Fyaml
https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-GOLANG-GOPKGINYAMLV3-2952714

**What was added between 0.4.0 and 0.5.0**
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/compare/v0.4.0...v0.5.0


## Related issues
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/issues/124

repo.description: A toolkit with common assertions and mocks that plays nicely with the standard library

issue.title: Protobuf serialization bug
issue.body:
Description
===========
Confluent-kafka-go v1.9.2

I am running a grpc server in go language. The APIs are defined using protobuf. 
Clients send data in a generic API where input object is defined as:
```
message Document {
    DocumentMeta meta = 1;
    bytes data = 2;
    google.protobuf.Any details = 3;
}
```

The details field uses Any type so that clients can send any type of message using this API. On server-side, the .proto files are used to register Message types 
```

protoFile, err := ioutil.ReadFile(tmp_file)
pb_set := new(descriptorpb.FileDescriptorSet)
if err := proto.Unmarshal(protoFile, pb_set); err != nil {
			return err
	}
pb := pb_set.GetFile()[0]
fd, err := protodesc.NewFile(pb, protoregistry.GlobalFiles)
msgType = dynamicpb.NewMessageType(fd.Messages().Get(0))
protoregistry.GlobalTypes.RegisterMessage(msgType)

```

The types get registered successfully and I can check them.

Data from any field is unmarshalled as follows to a protoreflect.ProtoMessage type
`msg, err := anypb.UnmarshalNew(doc.GetDetails(), proto.UnmarshalOptions{})`

When running `protobuf.serialize(topic, msg)`,  it fails in the `s.toProtobufSchema(protoMsg)` step with error
`error interface conversion: *dynamicpb.Message is not desc.protoMessage:  missing method Descriptor`

How to reproduce
================
Run the above steps, it can be deterministically reproduced.
1. Create an API with **Any** type field
2. Create a proto file on client-side, 
3. server will use the proto file from client to register message descriptors
4. Client will use proto file to send data via above API
5. On server-side, Unmarshal the data from Any field like `anypb.UnmarshalNew(doc.GetDetails(), proto.UnmarshalOptions{})`
7. serialize using protobuf.serialize(topic, msg) of confluent-kafka-go.


Checklist
=========
Please provide the following information:

 - [x] confluent-kafka-go and librdkafka version (`LibraryVersion()`):
 Confluent-kafka-go v1.9.2
 - [x] Apache Kafka broker version:
 NA since code does not reach schema-registry server, and fails before itself
 - [x] Client configuration: `ConfigMap{...}`
 NA
 - [x] Operating system:
 Mac Monterey 12.5
 - [x] Provide client logs (with `"debug": ".."` as necessary)
 - [x] Provide broker log excerpts
 - [x] Critical issue

comment.body:
Hi @Shukla-Ankur 

Did you get any solution to this problem? 

I'm also encountering this same error.

Thanks

issue.title: Unable to connect to a kafka cluster using SASL

labels.name: type/question
labels.description: An issue with a question which could possibly be converted into a discussion

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm getting the error below after following instructions in [SASL_SCRAM.md](https://github.com/provectus/kafka-ui/blob/master/documentation/guides/SASL_SCRAM.md) when connecting to a cluster via kafka-ui using SASL -
```
Error while creating AdminClient for Cluster cluster_name
```

**Set up**
Commit hash: [38c4cf7](https://github.com/provectus/kafka-ui/commit/38c4cf7)


**Steps to Reproduce**
I used the following invocation from under `charts/kafka-ui/` -
```
$ helm install kafka-ui . \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_NAME=cluster_name \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_BOOTSTRAPSERVERS=<ENDPOINT> \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SECURITY_PROTOCOL=SASL_SSL \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_MECHANISM=SCRAM-SHA-512 \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_JAAS_CONFIG="org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username='<USERNAME>' password='<PASSWORD>';"
```

The corresponding pod logs are -
```
...(stripped)...
        ssl.truststore.password = null
        ssl.truststore.type = JKS

2022-03-17 12:39:10,011 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.s.a.AbstractLogin: Successfully logged in.
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka version: 2.8.0
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka commitId: ebb1d6e21cc92130
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka startTimeMs: 1647520750108
2022-03-17 12:39:40,116 INFO  [kafka-admin-client-thread | adminclient-1] o.a.k.c.a.i.AdminMetadataManager: [AdminClient clientId=adminclient-1] Metadata update failed
org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Call(callName=fetchMetadata, deadlineMs=1647520780112, tries=1, nextAllowedTryMs=1647520780213) timed out at 1647520780113 after 1 attempt(s)
Caused by: org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting to send the call. Call: fetchMetadata
2022-03-17 12:40:10,115 ERROR [kafka-admin-client-thread | adminclient-1] c.p.k.u.s.MetricsService: Failed to collect cluster cluster_name info
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Error while creating AdminClient for Cluster cluster_name
```

I'm not sure if the line `Successfully logged in` indicates that the credentials are correct.

**Expected behavior**
I expected the metadata to be fetched successfully.

**Additional context**
The kafka cluster is provided via Confluent Cloud.

I was able to reproduce the same issue with the following `docker-compose.yaml` -
```
version: '3.4'
services:
  kafka-ui:
    image: provectuslabs/kafka-ui
    container_name: kafka-ui
    ports:
      - "9022:8080"
    restart: always
    environment:
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_NAME=cluster_name
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_BOOTSTRAPSERVERS=<ENDPOINT>
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SECURITY_PROTOCOL=SASL_SSL
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_MECHANISM=SCRAM-SHA-512
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_JAAS_CONFIG=org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username="<USERNAME>" password="<PASSWORD>";
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_PROTOCOL=SASL
```

comment.body:
Hi @shivansh 

Please, you can tell me how to resolved this problem? I can't to connect Kafka-ui on my kafka cloud confluent.

In your link i don't understand how to resolved this problem.

Thanks

forkee.name: testify
forkee.description: A toolkit with common assertions and mocks that plays nicely with the standard library

pull_request.title: upgrade objx to fix vulnerability
pull_request.body:
## Summary
This PR is to upgrade the objx dependency from 0.4.0 to 0.5.0

## Changes
Changed `go.mod` and `go.sum` files

## Motivation
Since the objx package 0.5.0 was released with a vulnerability fix made by dependabot, we could use the newest version of it.
This also will fix a vulnerability found in objx 0.4.0, by using the yamlv3 3.0.0 indirectly throught testify 1.7.1.

**current dependency tree**
```
- objx v0.4.0
   - testify v1.7.1
      - yaml.v3 v3.0.0
```

**Vulnerability details:**
https://security.snyk.io/package/golang/github.com%2Fgo-yaml%2Fyaml
https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-GOLANG-GOPKGINYAMLV3-2952714

**What was added between 0.4.0 and 0.5.0**
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/compare/v0.4.0...v0.5.0


## Related issues
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/issues/124

issue.title: upgrade objx to fix vulnerability
issue.body:
## Summary
This PR is to upgrade the objx dependency from 0.4.0 to 0.5.0

## Changes
Changed `go.mod` and `go.sum` files

## Motivation
Since the objx package 0.5.0 was released with a vulnerability fix made by dependabot, we could use the newest version of it.
This also will fix a vulnerability found in objx 0.4.0, by using the yamlv3 3.0.0 indirectly throught testify 1.7.1.

**current dependency tree**
```
- objx v0.4.0
   - testify v1.7.1
      - yaml.v3 v3.0.0
```

**Vulnerability details:**
https://security.snyk.io/package/golang/github.com%2Fgo-yaml%2Fyaml
https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-GOLANG-GOPKGINYAMLV3-2952714

**What was added between 0.4.0 and 0.5.0**
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/compare/v0.4.0...v0.5.0


## Related issues
https://github.com/stretchr/objx/issues/124

issue.title: Protobuf serialization bug
issue.body:
Description
===========
Confluent-kafka-go v1.9.2

I am running a grpc server in go language. The APIs are defined using protobuf. 
Clients send data in a generic API where input object is defined as:
```
message Document {
    DocumentMeta meta = 1;
    bytes data = 2;
    google.protobuf.Any details = 3;
}
```

The details field uses Any type so that clients can send any type of message using this API. On server-side, the .proto files are used to register Message types 
```

protoFile, err := ioutil.ReadFile(tmp_file)
pb_set := new(descriptorpb.FileDescriptorSet)
if err := proto.Unmarshal(protoFile, pb_set); err != nil {
			return err
	}
pb := pb_set.GetFile()[0]
fd, err := protodesc.NewFile(pb, protoregistry.GlobalFiles)
msgType = dynamicpb.NewMessageType(fd.Messages().Get(0))
protoregistry.GlobalTypes.RegisterMessage(msgType)

```

The types get registered successfully and I can check them.

Data from any field is unmarshalled as follows to a protoreflect.ProtoMessage type
`msg, err := anypb.UnmarshalNew(doc.GetDetails(), proto.UnmarshalOptions{})`

When running `protobuf.serialize(topic, msg)`,  it fails in the `s.toProtobufSchema(protoMsg)` step with error
`error interface conversion: *dynamicpb.Message is not desc.protoMessage:  missing method Descriptor`

How to reproduce
================
Run the above steps, it can be deterministically reproduced.
1. Create an API with **Any** type field
2. Create a proto file on client-side, 
3. server will use the proto file from client to register message descriptors
4. Client will use proto file to send data via above API
5. On server-side, Unmarshal the data from Any field like `anypb.UnmarshalNew(doc.GetDetails(), proto.UnmarshalOptions{})`
7. serialize using protobuf.serialize(topic, msg) of confluent-kafka-go.


Checklist
=========
Please provide the following information:

 - [x] confluent-kafka-go and librdkafka version (`LibraryVersion()`):
 Confluent-kafka-go v1.9.2
 - [x] Apache Kafka broker version:
 NA since code does not reach schema-registry server, and fails before itself
 - [x] Client configuration: `ConfigMap{...}`
 NA
 - [x] Operating system:
 Mac Monterey 12.5
 - [x] Provide client logs (with `"debug": ".."` as necessary)
 - [x] Provide broker log excerpts
 - [x] Critical issue

comment.body:
Hi @Shukla-Ankur 

Did you get any solution to this problem? 

I'm also encountering this same error.

Thanks

issue.title: Unable to connect to a kafka cluster using SASL

labels.name: type/question
labels.description: An issue with a question which could possibly be converted into a discussion

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm getting the error below after following instructions in [SASL_SCRAM.md](https://github.com/provectus/kafka-ui/blob/master/documentation/guides/SASL_SCRAM.md) when connecting to a cluster via kafka-ui using SASL -
```
Error while creating AdminClient for Cluster cluster_name
```

**Set up**
Commit hash: [38c4cf7](https://github.com/provectus/kafka-ui/commit/38c4cf7)


**Steps to Reproduce**
I used the following invocation from under `charts/kafka-ui/` -
```
$ helm install kafka-ui . \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_NAME=cluster_name \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_BOOTSTRAPSERVERS=<ENDPOINT> \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SECURITY_PROTOCOL=SASL_SSL \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_MECHANISM=SCRAM-SHA-512 \
  --set envs.config.KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_JAAS_CONFIG="org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username='<USERNAME>' password='<PASSWORD>';"
```

The corresponding pod logs are -
```
...(stripped)...
        ssl.truststore.password = null
        ssl.truststore.type = JKS

2022-03-17 12:39:10,011 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.s.a.AbstractLogin: Successfully logged in.
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka version: 2.8.0
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka commitId: ebb1d6e21cc92130
2022-03-17 12:39:10,110 INFO  [parallel-1] o.a.k.c.u.AppInfoParser: Kafka startTimeMs: 1647520750108
2022-03-17 12:39:40,116 INFO  [kafka-admin-client-thread | adminclient-1] o.a.k.c.a.i.AdminMetadataManager: [AdminClient clientId=adminclient-1] Metadata update failed
org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Call(callName=fetchMetadata, deadlineMs=1647520780112, tries=1, nextAllowedTryMs=1647520780213) timed out at 1647520780113 after 1 attempt(s)
Caused by: org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting to send the call. Call: fetchMetadata
2022-03-17 12:40:10,115 ERROR [kafka-admin-client-thread | adminclient-1] c.p.k.u.s.MetricsService: Failed to collect cluster cluster_name info
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Error while creating AdminClient for Cluster cluster_name
```

I'm not sure if the line `Successfully logged in` indicates that the credentials are correct.

**Expected behavior**
I expected the metadata to be fetched successfully.

**Additional context**
The kafka cluster is provided via Confluent Cloud.

I was able to reproduce the same issue with the following `docker-compose.yaml` -
```
version: '3.4'
services:
  kafka-ui:
    image: provectuslabs/kafka-ui
    container_name: kafka-ui
    ports:
      - "9022:8080"
    restart: always
    environment:
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_NAME=cluster_name
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_BOOTSTRAPSERVERS=<ENDPOINT>
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SECURITY_PROTOCOL=SASL_SSL
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_MECHANISM=SCRAM-SHA-512
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_SASL_JAAS_CONFIG=org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram.ScramLoginModule required username="<USERNAME>" password="<PASSWORD>";
      - KAFKA_CLUSTERS_0_PROPERTIES_PROTOCOL=SASL
```
